pros: They have great maternity benefits, they give discounts for uniforms, medical, dental & pay time off.
cons: They wont give bonus and won’t give fair opportunity to grow in the company.

pros: I absolutely love Lakeland Regional. Please don’t be deterred by the 1 Star on HealthGrades, this is a wonderful place and the managers truly care about the staff. I primarily work in the SICU, but we can also pick up in other ICU units (Neuro ICU / MICU / TICU). It is a wonderful place to work. The staff is helpful, the managers have your back, and the doctors are team players. There is no Doctor vs. Nurse or Dayshift vs. Nightshift. Everyone is part of a team, and it makes for a great place to work. Here is the skinny…. WORK DAYS….We work 3/12s, and there is always the opportunity to pick up more shifts. Currently, you have the option to work your 3 shifts on weekdays only, weekends with 1 weekday, or weekdays with rotating weekends, however I have heard they are only doing rotating weekends in the future (every other weekend). PATIENTS - The patients are very respectful and pleasant, which is amazing! Obviously, not everyone is going to be nice, but it’s so much better than others places I’ve worked where the patients are rude, hateful, and try to push your buttons in the hopes you will overstep so they can sue you. FLOAT DAYS - Every 4th shift, we do have the potential to float to a floor, and when we do, everyone is so appreciative. BENEFITS - Aetna for medical and MetLife for Dental. The price you pay depends on your family size. There is also a good 403b, Roth IRA, life insurance, and short / long term disability. If you have to do light duty, they will allow you to work in the Tele room. EARNED TIME OFF (ETO) - I believe they start you with 2 weeks of EARNED time, meaning you have to accrue it….you don’t immediately have 2 weeks on January 1, but you can usually find someone to cover your shift.
cons: Just minor things really… - Not a Magnet hospital, but working on it. - In my opinion, the nursing pay could be better. - Intermittent staffing shortages, but that is everywhere. - The day shift employees (at least in the ICUs) have to park across the street, which can be inconvenient during bad weather. - We just started our ECMO program and are still working out the kinks, but overall, it’s going great! - The cafeteria is expensive, they charge an arm and a leg for salad bc they charge by weight. - There are quite a few morbidly obese patients, so please be kind to your back when turning. But, there are always people willing to help.

job_title: Nurse, Medical Records, Coder in Lakeland, FL
pros: I loved coding & being able to use my 20+ years of nursing experience in critical care to assist other coders.  Loved having a sit-down job!  Loved what I did & it was a very friendly group of coworkrers.
cons: Manager at the time was either barking commands & criticisms or praising you for your work.  We had tons of paperwork. meetings, conferences, even peer reviews where we had to critique each other's work in front of everybody.  Tense atmosphere.

pros: Nursing Union. It's a teaching hospital and they hire new grad nurses into a RN residency program, which offers a longer orientation/training phase and really helps you feel grounded as a new nurse.
cons:
Unfortunately, they can't seem to hold onto people hospital wide. They're chronically understaffed, especially in the winter months. I heard someone in HR say approximately 60% of the nurses in the entire hospital have less than 5 years experience. LRMC has a base pay that's somewhat comparable to other hospitals in the area, but they have poor shift differentials. Also, they don't offer ICU pay, which is frustrating. 

Base pay: $26/hr
Evening differential (3p-11p): $4.18/hr
Night differential (11p-7a): $5.67/hr
If you're hired into weekend nights, they give you approximately $12 additionally for the Saturday/Sunday night combo. Not sure what the day shift weekend differential is.

pros: Great teamwork, Manager on board gets the job done right.
cons: Dayshift has alot of tasks at hand, trying to get quality care during dayshift is a struggle but the staff does a great job and gives the patients the best of care, I wouldnt want my loved one anywhere else.

review_title: Not the best place to work, not even close
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Lakeland, FL
pros: Great Co-workers, and constant job openings because they can't keep anyone.
cons: Little care or appreciation for employees, sub-par pay and constant excuses as to why bonuses will not be given(regardless of unreasonable expectations) which results in laughable employee retention rates, management has no backbone and will throw employees under the bus without hesitation, and patient care suffers as a result, which is sad, because without the patients, none of us (or them) would have jobs.

review_title: Its not what you know, its who you know.
pros: Job security? Nice people to work with but poorly managed.
cons:
Too many lazy people who get away with doing very little. The good employees take up the lazy employees slack. If they didn't the place would come to a stop. 24 hour pharmacy department where each shift rotation blames the other. The service could be so much more efficient with some effective management.
The training in learn as you go. There is no explanation of how things work yet you are expected to answer calls to help nurses with an issue. Frustration?

pros: Good pay and ok benefits
cons:
-Very little teamwork, a lot of employees when they are done with their work surf the web instead of helping their co-workers.
-Working here is like going back in time 10 years ago or more, a lot of antiquated procedures and equipment.
-Serology tests are more complicated than they need to be which slows down the turnaround times. During flu season, you get hundreds of flu tests, but there is no automated system for this! 
-2 supervisors, neither which know what is going on in the department since they don't talk to the employees much and there are never department meetings.
-The bench techs that read cultures are the only employees in this department are treated well.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Lakeland, FL
pros: It is definitely good for someone in nursing school coming in to get a jump on skills.
cons: There is severe understaffing issues. Different units have different standards. Some units have wonderful team work where most units everyone is out to fend for themselves. The patient ratios are not based on acuity so as a PCA you may be given 12 patients for the shift and 8 of them are total q2 turns, 4 are 1:1 feeders, and all need assistance with ADLs. The nurses are usually just as swamped and are unable to assist you. It is not hard to become burnt out. Upper management doesn’t care. Extremely high turn over rate because of the issues above.

pros: Every other Friday off in IT.  Pay is okay.
cons: Where to begin.  This is a company you want to run away from.  Not walk.... run.  They have such archaic policies.  LRH never plans anything out.  Managers do not communicate with each other.  No one knows what other groups are working on. Turn over is very high.  They can't get people to stay.  Management does not care that people keep leaving.  Their view is, oh well, we will just hire someone else.  If you are lucky to have one of the good managers (there are two of them) then your time will be tolerable, but you will still have to put up with idiots.  People get fired all the time, but the idiots for some reason don't.  Go figure.

review_title: Good to get experience, get what you need and GET OUT!
pros: Benefits are expensive but worth it if you stay in LRH network (100% covered) although schedule about 2 months out. Holiday differentials are ok. The cafe always has great food, coffee and sushi.
cons: Pay is the worst ,sadly,  thats what comes with a "learning" hospital. CEO's paycheck keeps increasing while employees plummet. They hire people desperate for experience and pay them minimum.. very hard to survive on. The culture of employees does not follow vision of "community."Racism within employees.  Very very understaffed, I would sometimes have 15 "totals" (high care) patients all to myself where it is impossible to give quality care.  Also be careful in employees parking theres countless thefts.

review_title: Nuclear imaging department is run poorly due to lack of communication, leadship, and management.
pros:
1) Merrit raises
2) Healthcare benefits
cons:
1) Good ol' boy system - many middle managers are grandfathered into their position and are not qualified to manage; in addition, they have no formal training or education
2) Workload doesn't allow for downtime - management has no backbone and won't stand up for employees to resolve workload problems with senior management
3) Bad moral - many technologists are overworked and resent working with each other
4) High Administrative/Director turnover - priorities are constantly changed based on new administrators coming and going

pros: I work with a great bunch of people.....
cons: I am in housekeeping and have been there 10 years, it has gotten so bad in our department... We do not have enough staff to cover all our floors, especially on the weekends, we all have35 or more rooms to clean and do daily's in, and the discharges that come when our patients leave not to mention the nurses and visitor areas that have to be maintained. It all gets very overwhelming and our managers do not seem to care.I feel and a lot of other do also "Opinions" do not count at this job..

review_title: LRH was one of the best experiences I my life!
pros: Great entry into the healthcare field. One of the busiest ER rooms in the nation. I look forward to returning after I finish my post grad schooling!
cons: None at the moment. More staff would be great, like with any job. Since we’ve moved to multiple campuses you don’t see key staff much anymore. More upper management presents on the campus would be encouraging. Just come in and talk to the everyday staff.

review_title: Be happy you have ANY job, not happy you have YOUR job.
job_title: Patient Access Representative in Lakeland, FL
pros: Good food in the cafeteria. Flexible earned time off depending on your manager's flexibility. Competitive pay. Level 2 trauma center with great community respect and recognition.
cons: Department politics. Supervisors and managers "in it" for their own advancement and praise while failing to deliver the same to hard working employees. Ridiculous parking rules and security staff happy to place a boot on your car and charge you up $25.

pros: Decent salary for area. Sincere coworkers. Every other Friday off.
cons: 67% turnover in my department in one year, and upper management turns a blind eye, even though all arrows point to the reason for the high turnover. Five out of nine coworkers in my department either quit or where let go in the seven months I was there. Upper Management micro manages good employees right out the door.

review_title: We've made it better for the public, now let's make it better for the employees.
pros: Expansion is a plus, medical benefits have always been great....however, they just changed as of January 2016 so time will tell.
cons: Not enough financial incentive. People that have been working there for years are making the same as entry level employees because the establishment only offers one raise per year and it's minimal (not keeping up with the actual cost of living). Therefore, it's difficult to feel as though you are well-compensated and paid your worth. It's quite discouraging.

job_title: HIMS Coder II in Lakeland, FL
pros: Was able to work remotely from home. Was a great place to work and had a great coding team when it was Lakeland Regional Medical Center, before my last 3 months there, after 10, almost 11 years of employment when Lakeland Regional Health took over and everything went downhill from there.
cons: Poor new management. No work life balance at all. Made me choose my job over being there for my kid. No support and micromanagement.

job_title: Behavioral Health Tech in Springfield, MO
pros: Possibly helping a adolescent with behavioral problems better themselves. There are not really any other pros to this company!
cons: So understaffed you have to work either 12-16 hour shifts when only scheduled 8 hours.  The staff plays the highschool click drama, management knows and doesn't fix it.  They lie to the patients and feed them nasty food.  Lie and say you start pay is higher from experience, but same rate of pay to a person with zero experience.   The pay is extremely low for the amount of work you do.  Never get raises.

review_title: Ok place to work if you're desparate for a job
pros:
-Wasn't micro managed
-good work/life balance
cons:
-IT department needs a overhaul, many of the IT folks were there for a long time and did not keep up with the dynamics of the changing world of IT, thus products were outdated
-management direction/decisions were based on satisfying clinicians, did not follow own rules/policies
-management red tape on movement within IT
-certain teams did not collaborate well with each other
-outdated tools
-no budget for updating anything

job_title: Nurse Tech in Saint Joseph, MI
pros: This is a great place to work because you can move up quickly to other positions. There are also a lot of great managers working here and they will try to help you succeed. Also there are always hours to work so you don't have worry about not getting enough hours.
cons: At times it is understaffed and management can be unsympathetic on this topic. I also do not think there is enough recognition for all the workers regardless if the patients recommend them or not.

review_title: I enjoyed working and helping others especially patients that came in through the ER looking for help w/med. bills
job_title: Benefits Consultant/Social Worker in Lakeland Highlands, FL
pros: I enjoyed being a benefits consultant because I was able to help most patients apply for either Medicaid or the state issued medical insurance to help pay for their medical bills if they qualified.
cons: It was difficult at times when there would be one or more non-citizen patients that didn't qualify for any type of insurance to help pay their medical bills and most of them were low income families.

pros: There was quite a bit of camaraderie between the  employees and most of management. The hospital was very Pro community and was in the process of building on a separate Women's and Children's Tower to accommodate Community needs.
cons: Medical benefits package was quite expensive however the hospital did pay a good portion of it. It would have been nice if the hospital would have attempted to place me in a different position rather than lay me off (after 18 years of service) due to restructuring.

pros: One of the largest employers in town
cons:
Poorly treated
Expensive health insurance, only valid at their hospital
If you don't have a degree you are told that you are worthless, and unpromotable. Your co-worker with the same titie with a degree and no experience will make $20,000 more a year than you do and do absolutely no work for it. 
If you have more than 30yrs seniority look out, you will be let go to make way for more Vice Presidents. They need the $ for the big shots so they "let go" the peons. Hit the road Jack.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Lakeland, FL
pros: They offer benefits to people working 24 hours a week, there are lots of opportunities for advancement and transfers within the hospital, and they continually try to include all employees in hospital news and improvement.
cons: There weren't many downsides to working at LRMC. The only complaint I have is there wasn't enough staffing when I was working as a Patient Care Assistant. Sometimes I would have 15-18 patients all on my own and that isn't safe.

review_title: Learned a lot met some great people
job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Lakeland, FL
pros: You will  gain excellent knowledge and experience. Work hard but be rewarded for it. And meet some awesome doctors. The building  is kept clean and organized as well.
cons: This is a large hospital for where it is located. And it is extremely  busy.  Beware there can be days when there are staff shortages and that will pit everyone  on turbo.

pros: Great place to learn new things.
cons: Not enough staff on the evening shift for only 3 staff members to cover 24 Operating rooms plus cover EP lab, Cath lab, and GI suites.

review_title: Overall, it's been positive. They are constantly growing and trying to better there reputation.
pros: They have many employees who have been with the hospital for 10+ years. There is an overall respect for the hospital in the community. They are constantly striving to increase their core measure scores. They try to incorporate evidenced based practice into their protocol.
cons: There is no clinical ladder for nurses. Doctors and pharmacists don't round together.

review_title: It was a learning experience through co workers and the job atmosphere
pros: Good benefits, close to my house
cons: A big Peyton place, everybody gossiping about their days off and not concerned with the patients. on the computer on their cell phones playing Angry Birds or whatever.

review_title: A good place to work and learn.
pros: With such a large company there is always room to grow and develop your career.
cons: Because of the size of the organization, communication was difficult. Communication from senior leadership was filtered through several 'layers of management' to front line employees and was often unclear and inconsistent.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Lakeland, FL
pros: Great place to work when conditions are favorable.
cons: Left to continue education and now need to work again.  I have tried to get in touch with the recruitment staff but no connection regarding rehire.  I would really like to work with the staff at Lakeland Regional Health once more.

review_title: A leading employer in Central Florida!
pros: Lakeland Regional is growing exponentially which means plenty of opportunities for years to come!   They are heavily involved with the community and committed to providing the highest level of service to their patients and loved ones.
cons: With tremendous growth there are growing pains... this requires you to be flexible and open to change.

review_title: Does Not care for their employees Org Promises are Lies
pros: I can't think of any reason to work there unless it is the only job you can get life is to short to work in a place that has no compassion for their employees and since the merger with C&D patient care has taken a back seat to collecting money
cons: The do not care about their employees some C&D managers build their careers on lies push out old LRH employees anyway that they can so that they can snag a stable position in an old LRH clinic for one of their own employees.  They literally talk down to the employees and say I can because I'm the boss a lot especially if you ask why.  Don't go out on maternity leave because if you ask for extended leave to care for your baby I promise you they will post your position before you return,  some managers if they don't like you will conjure up emails and employees to lie to get you fired it is always hear say someone said you said this and they write you up but there is never any real proof that you did anything at all just one persons word against yours.  Would never recommend anyone to work here unless they cleaned house and hired people who truly care oh and let me say that the HR team that was there for ever disappeared after the merger and the new HR team does what ever the managers want without ever looking at a policy or law way to go LRH I am sure you will be your attorneys highest paying customer in the near future

review_title: Only place in this town for a nurse
job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Joseph, MI
pros: People are nice and the lake is beautiful in the summer time.   If you can make friends with the right people, you can advance quickly without ever having to go back to school.
cons: They place no value on education BSN make the same as ADN and if they can, they will replace you with an LPN.

review_title: Great experience, this job offers so many learning opportunities in the medical field.
pros: You will experience and learn so much working in this fast paced medical environment. If you show initiative in learning people will more than go out of their way to help you.
cons: You walk a hell of a lot and the pay doesn’t quite add up to the work that you will do.

pros: Tuition Reimbursement; however, this has changed recently.  Nurses no longer allowed to pursue education for nurse practitioner and receive tuition reimbursement.
cons: Financial difficulties as a company, including layoffs to open other higher positions.  Cut employees; however, increased the responsibilities of the employees left.  Do not care about their employees or patients.  Terrible short-term disability and insurance options.

review_title: Great hospital, but cutting costs and not as efficient as it was a year ago.
job_title: Accounts Payable Clerk in Lakeland, FL
pros: The ER has improved a lot.
cons: Working in the Accounting Department has become overwhelming and impossible to keep up with due to budget cuts.

review_title: One of the best companies in Lakeland to work for.
job_title: Environmental Services Aid in Lakeland, FL
pros: Shift differential for evening and night shift.  Culture of caring.  Generous Earned Time Off.  A lot of opportunities for advancement.
cons: Health insurance is very expensive.  There are so many people applying for advancement opportunities its hard to get them.

pros: People here are very helpful. They keep up with advancements in care. You're always learning something new. And, you always feel like you've made an impact in the care of your patients.
cons: Because it's a large hospital, it's kind of hard to keep well staffed. So, you do more work than at other facilities.

review_title: Upper management running good employees out
pros: No good reasons left.
cons: It is all about money, not about patients.  Employees that worked here for over ten years are been chased out.  Upper management is about the the money.  Patient care has gone down the drain.  People are quitting, complainting to hr and the CEO and nothing is being done.

pros: Insurance Benifits, easy transfers, pays for school up to a certain amount, chance for a raise yearly based on customer satisfaction survey.
cons: Lack of communication, disorganized, doesn't hold rest of staff accountable, not a fair workload. Thoughts and ideas always requested but never taken into action.

pros: Some of the people I work with are nice. Cafeteria has pretty good food.  Starbucks on site.
cons: Worst management I have ever encountered and I’ve worked in the food industry! Only feedback purely negative. Management will NEVER I repeat NEVER back you on any issue EVER. Worst communication skills between management and employees. Certain people favored over others highly “cliquey”.  Not a lot of opportunities for advancement or raise in pay.

pros: Annual raises and bonuses. Encouragement of personal growth and tuition reimbursement for educational advancement.  LRH is actively caring for the community and is growing! Solid upper Management.
cons: Parking can be a nightmare especially if you get off shift  in the middle of the night.

pros: pay is okay. have formed some good friendships with coworkers who are also dissatisfied
cons: Little tangible support from management. Stretched thin every day and expected to be in a million places at once.

review_title: This job has worked well with being a full time college student.

pros: We take great care of our employees and our patients.  There is not a better place to work in Central Florida!

pros: LRMC is an excellent hospital to work for.  Great pay, great benefits.
